sections.title: Overview of FTC Motor Types
sections.content:
FTC robots use a variety of DC motors, each with different capabilities. Choosing the right motor for your robot is important for performance and reliability.

For more, see FTC Docs: Creating and Running an Op Mode.

sections.title: Common FTC Motors
sections.content:
Some common FTC motors include:
  • REV HD Hex Motor
  • AndyMark NeveRest
  • Tetrix Motor
Each motor has different speed, torque, and encoder options.

sections.title: Choosing the Right Motor
sections.content:
Consider the following when choosing a motor:
  • Torque: Needed for lifting or pushing heavy objects.
  • Speed: Needed for fast movement.
  • Size and weight: Must fit your robot design.

sections.title: Reading Motor Specifications
sections.content: Always check the motor's datasheet for voltage, current, speed, and torque ratings. This helps you avoid damaging your hardware and ensures your robot performs as expected.

sections.title: Programming Differences
sections.content: Most FTC DC motors are programmed the same way. However, some may require different initialization or settings. Always check the manufacturer's documentation.
